name: Do not use EQUIVALENCE in Modules  (FORTRAN)
description: The number of EQUIVALENCE statements are counted per artifact; whenever the artifact has 1 or more occurences of this statement, it is considered as being in violation. The number of EQUIVALENCE statements is presented in the value of the violated artifact.
rationale: Use of the instruction EQUIVALENCE is forbidden.
remediation: Reduce the number of EQUIVALENCE statements, or seek alternatives to this statement
alternativeName: Do not use EQUIVALENCE in Modules  (FORTRAN)
